message.content:
I need to identify the line item that shows the entity's profit after all expenses have been deducted.

Looking at the cash flow statement, I can see a line item called "Net Profit" with a value of -1,401,436.89. This represents the entity's profit (in this case, a loss) after all expenses have been accounted for.

The Net Profit line item is typically the starting point of the cash flow statement's operating section, and it represents the bottom-line profit or loss after considering all revenue, operating costs, interest, taxes, depreciation, and amortization.

Therefore, the amount of profit (in this case, loss) that the entity retains after all expenses is -1,401,436.89.

```json
{"solution": {'value': '-1401436.89'}}
```
